question:
Which of the following are valid domain names?

    ```
    1. Google.com

    2. Google.co.uk

    3. Google.com.br
    ```
explanation:
All three domains are valid. Domain names that finish in
    `co.uk` is generally used in the United Kingdom, while `com.br` is common
    in Brazil.

question:
Which of the following domain names is the oldest?

    ```
    1. icann.org, owned by ICANN, the organization that coordinates internet names registration

    2. apple.com, owned by Apple Inc.

    3. w3.org, owned by the W3C, founded by Tim Berners-Lee, inventor of the World Wide Web
    ```
explanation:
The domain `icann.org` is owned by *Internet Corporation
    for Assigned Names and Numbers* (ICANN), the organization responsible
    for coordinating domain names registration. However, it was only founded
    in **September of 1998**, ten years after the World Wild Web was invented.

    

    The web was invented in 1989 by Time Berners-Lee, at the European
    Organization for Nuclear Research (CERN). It is unclear when CERN
    registered `cern.ch`, but likely
    [after November
    1987](http://www.domainholdings.com/recent-sales/100-oldest-domain-names/)
    and [before the end of
    1990](https://www.w3.org/People/Berners-Lee/FAQ.html#Examples).

    

    It is however known that `apple.com`
